Name: Issue 301
Introduction: It's still technically the weekend in other parts of the world, so hope you are enjoying it. This edition has some interesting links for those of you looking at Maui. As always thanks to the wonderful Xamarin community for their content.  Speaking of which, if you see some content you think should be in WeeklyXamarin, let us know by using our submission form - [https://bit.ly/WeeklyXamarinSubmit](https://bit.ly/WeeklyXamarinSubmit) Have a great week! ‚ù§ Kym

Articles.Title: Xamarin Best Practices
Articles.Description: Jesse posted a blog post on C# best practices recently.  In this post he covers his Xamarin best practices.
Articles.Author: Jesse Liberty

Articles.Title: Adventures in ARKit
Articles.Description: David Britch continues his exploration of ARKit. Make sure to heck out his articles and follow along.
Articles.Author: David Britch

Articles.Title: Accessing device contacts
Articles.Description: Sometimes we have to integrate some functionalities into our Apps that require obtaining information from contacts, previously, to achieve this we had to take more development time, but now we have very good news!!! Xamarin Essentials included it for us!üíö We can implement this simply and easily! In this post, we will be learning how to do it! üòé
Articles.Author: Leomaris Reyes

Articles.Title: Great Looking Settings Screens for Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: Checkout some quick tips to theme the built in controls in Xamarin.Forms to make your settings screen look absolutely fantastic.
Articles.Author: James Montemagno

Articles.Title: Xamarin.Forms UI/UX Challenges - Micuna Food - Part2
Articles.Description: Daniel Montetelli continues his UI challenge, this time focusing on incorporating goodness from the Xamarin Community Toolkit".
Articles.Author: Daniel Monetelli

Articles.Title: Getting Started with Local Notifications Xamarin Forms
Articles.Description: Get acquainted with local notifications, the alerts sent by applications installed on our mobile device without needing a back-end server to push them.
Articles.Author: Leomaris Reyes

Articles.Title: Sneak Peek at 2021 Volume 1: Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: Syncfusion is about to release a new version of it's Xamarin.Forms controls. This blog post gives you a quick overview of the new features that are planned.
Articles.Author: Syncfusion

Articles.Title: I updated a Xamarin Forms project to Maui
Articles.Description: Now that *very* early Maui bits are out, Brad is living on the bleeding edge by creating a Xamarin.Forms project and convert it to Maui.
Articles.Author: Brad Dean

Articles.Title: Extending Xamarin.Forms.Nuke for images that fail to load
Articles.Description: I wasn't aware of the Xamarin.Forms.Nuke library for better image handling on Xamarin.Forms iOS. This post discusses how to extend it to implement placeholder images when loading fails.
Articles.Author: Marco Siccardi

Articles.Title: Pull-To-Refresh Everything with RefreshView in Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: Implement Pull-To-Refresh with any kind of layout with RefreshView that is available for you in Xamarin.Forms. In this video we will learn how to implement and customize this controls and how to refresh data in your application.
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis

Articles.Title: HTTP Web Requests with Data Caching | Xamarin 101
Articles.Description: The time has come to create and consume our ASP.NET Core Web API from our mobile application. In this Xamarin 101 video we take a look at calling CRUD operations from our Xamarin mobile app to our Web API backend. I step through what REST and HTTP is, how it works, how to call it, and how to cache data easily in your mobile apps.
Articles.Author: James Montemagno

Articles.Title: Learn What's New in Xamarin.Forms 5 with Microsoft MVP Alessandro Del Sole
Articles.Description: This blog provides show notes from the SyncFusion "Learn What's New in Xamarin.Forms 5." Webinar with Microsoft MVP Alessandro Del Sole.
Articles.Author: Syncfusion

Articles.Title: Xamarin Community Toolkit - Forget Time Zones with DateTimeOffsetConverter
Articles.Description: In this episode we will learn everything about the DateTimeOffsetConverter that is included in the Xamarin Community Toolkit. Mark Allibone knows from first-hand experience that sometimes, in a backend, dates are stored as an offset. To not be bother with all kinds of time zone hassles, he wrote the DateTimeOffsetConverter. And now, Mark has contributed that converter to the Xamarin Community Toolkit so everyone can benefit!
Articles.Author: The Xamarin Show

Articles.Title: Merge Conflict: 245: Doubling Down on Cross-Platform Development
Articles.Description: .NET MAUI may be on the way, but Xamarin.Forms 5 is here today! We discuss the journey and what is next.
Articles.Author: Merge Conflict
